title: Strictly's Mike Bushell and Chris Ramsey get back to rehearsals amid claims the show is fixed
text:
They lived to survive another week after Dev Griffin and Dianne Bushell's elimination on Sunday caused Strictly Come Dancing to be hit with fix claims.

And Mike Bushell and Chris Ramsey looked unphased by the criticism as they joined their fellow Strictly stars in getting back into rehearsals on Monday.

The sports presenter, 53, and the comedian, 33, appeared in high spirits as they left their hotel, giving the thumbs up as they posed for a snap together before getting into a waiting car.

Fun: Mike Bushell, 53, and Chris Ramsey, 33, looked in high spirits as they joined their fellow Strictly stars in getting back into rehearsals on Monday

Chris cut a casual figure in a white t-shirt and blue jeans while Mike wore a blue printed shirt with black trousers.

Meanwhile, professional dancer Gorka Marquez was also spotted departing the hotel.

The TV star kept it casual in a gold hoodie and black tracksuit bottoms while he carried a cup of coffee.

Dev Griffin has become the third celebrity to be eliminated from this year's Strictly Come Dancing on Sunday, following an unexpected dance-off against Viscountess Emma Weymouth.

Claims: Their outing comes after Dev Griffin and Dianne Bushell's elimination on Sunday caused Strictly Come Dancing to be hit with fix claims

On Saturday evening, fans of the show took to Twitter to claim that they 'couldn't vote' for Dev and Dianne, because their designated 'phone line wouldn't accept calls,' with others viewers furiously branding the show a 'fix' following Sunday's results.

At 8.57pm on Saturday night, the official Strictly Twitter account wrote: 'There's a high volume of calls tonight, so if you don't get though first time keep trying! And remember you can vote online.'

A spokesperson for Strictly Come Dancing told MailOnline: 'The phone line blockages impacted all contestants equally — and that the likelihood of getting through was not dependent upon the celebrity fans wanted to vote for.'

Out and about: Professional dancer Gorka Marquez , 29, was also spotted departing the hotel in a gold hoodie and black tracksuit bottoms

Laid back: Chris cut a casual figure in a white t-shirt and blue jeans while Mike wore a blue printed shirt with black trousers

Fans: Mike posed for a snap with a group outside the hotel before making his way

Viewers vowed to boycott Strictly as they were left seething over the results, with one person tweeting: 'Makes me not wanna watch anymore when bulls**t like this happens he was way better #Strictly.'

One fan sent a tweet to Dianne Buswell, which read: 'I can’t believe you have left. You were amazing. My 12 year old daughter is refusing to watch anymore as she’s so upset.'

As he learned of his fate on Sunday night, radio presenter Dev admitted his devastation, telling show host Tess Daly: 'I'm not going to lie I am absolutely gutted.'

Dev continued: 'But, learning how to dance, hanging out with Dianne and the other pros and celebs… I've absolutely loved it.'

Sent home: Dev Griffin, 34, has become the third celebrity to be eliminated from this year's Strictly Come Dancing on Sunday

Suspicious: Viewers were extremely suspicious of Sunday night's results

Keep trying: The official Strictly account on Twitter acknowledged that some people trying to vote weren't getting through on the phone lines, and urged fans to keep trying

Saved: The judges voted unanimously to save chef Emma Weymouth after the dance-off

Praising her celebrity dance partner, Dianne said: 'Dev has been absolutely amazing. His work ethic is insane. I see him everywhere practising and I couldn't have asked for a better partner.

'Thank you so much for all your time and your effort. This boy has so much talent, I'm really sad he won't be able to show you guys any more of it.'

The pair's early exit was particularly notable, as just last weekend, Dev and Dianne came second on the leaderboard thanks to an incredible performance to Friend Like Me from 2019's Aladdin remake.

Moreover, on Saturday night, Dev and Dianne were scored 27 out of 40 for their Cha Cha Cha by the judges, leaving them tenth out of 13.
description: The pair looked unphased by the criticism as they joined their fellow Strictly stars in getting back into rehearsals on Monday.
